name: 葉樹開
objective:
介紹各種奈米結構材料：奈米碳管、奈米線、量子點、量子線和奈米複合材料的基本特性以及製備與應用技術，期能對奈米材料的物性、製造與應用有整體的認識。			
先修課程: General Physics, General Chemistry, Physical Chemistry 
Textbook:	D. L. Schodek, P. Ferreira and M. F. Ashby, “Nanomaterials, Nanotechnologies and Design: An Introduction for Engineers and Architects” Butterworth-Heinemann (June 11, 2009)
Course Objectives:	
A. Provide a brief review of material history
B. Provide a brief review of nanotechnology
C. Learn to understand the properties of nanomaterials
D. Learn to understand the chemistry of nanomaterials
schedule:
Course Outline:
1.	Nanomaterials and Nanotechnologies
2.	An Evolutionary Perspective
3.	The Design Context
4.	Material Classes, Structure, and Properties
5.	Material Property Charty and Their Uses
6.	Nanomaterials: Class and Fundamentals
7.	Nanomaterials: Properties
8.	Nanomaterials: Synthesis and Characterization
9.	Design Environments and Systems
10.	Nanomaterial Product Forms and Functions
11.	Nanomaterial and Nanotechnologies in Health and Environment
12.	The Broader Context
scorePolicy:
Grades: 
Grades will be determined from a composite score of all graded materials, consisting of: two midterm exams, homework problems, and the comprehensive final exam. Weights used to determine the final score will be:
1. Homework problems, 15%
2. In-Class Activities, Quizzes 10%
3. Two exams, 60% (midterm 30%, final 30%)
4. Final Project, 15%
Homework Rules:		
1.	Homework problems are due at the beginning of class.
2.	Please work the homework early to avoid lateness due to computer crashes.
3.	Answer keys will be posted on http://elearning.ntut.edu.tw 
4.	You may discuss with others how to begin working problems, but you must work the problem entirely yourself to hand in for credit. You may not share computer files for homework problems until the case study.
5.	Anyone who share computer files or copy homework from classmates will subject to a 50% off his/her homework credit.
Exams:
All exams will be held in our normal classroom.
Final Exam:
All students must take the final exam to pass the course. Finals will not be given at any other time. There will not be a makeup exam.
